title.narrative: Efficient Use of Fuel and Alternative Fuels in Indigenous and Rural Communities in Guatemala

description.narrative: Guatemala is committed to create improved conditions for sustainable and efficient firewood use and has set up a Firewood Commission to implement the National Firewood Strategy. With financial and technical support mechanisms, the project stimulates supply and demand for energy efficient cookstoves. Enhanced coordination and consolidation of national and international support is required to upscale and ensure long-term sustainability in the implementation of clean cooking technologies, and for fortifying participatory governance to implement the National Firewood Strategy. Possible co-benefits include reduction in forest degradation and improved economic conditions of households (via reduced need to purchase fuel and time spent collecting firewood) for approx. 1.1 m people, mostly indigenous women and children. Approximately 1.7MtCO2e will be mitigated by the end of the project and 9 MtCO2e up until the end of 2027t.
